translation.at-least-one-email: At least one email is required
translation.address-is-not-token: The address is not a token
translation.endtimeGreaterThanStarttime: End time must be greater than start time
translation.not-safe-address: Not a multisig address (check address or network)
translation.not-enough-safe-members: Not enough members (minimum is {{min}} and now is only {{now}})
translation.not-enough-safe-signers: Not enough multisig signers (minimum is {{min}} and now is only {{now}})
translation.pleaseConfirmTransaction: Please confirm the transaction in your wallet
translation.weAreProcessingWithdrawRequest: We are processing your withdrawal request. In a couple of seconds you will see the status of your request.
translation.safeProposalCreatedSuccessfully:
The Gnosis Safe proposal was created successfully. Please continue the process on your Gnosis Safe wallet. 

 You can go back here and click on the refresh button when the transaction is executed on-chain.
translation.safeProposalCreatedSuccessfullyWithoutGo: The Gnosis Safe proposal was created successfully. Please continue the process on your Gnosis Safe wallet.
translation.vulnerabilitySubmitted: Your report was successfully submitted to the committee!
translation.addPgpPublicKey: Press to open PGP key store
translation.vaultEditorCommitteeMembersSafeExplanati:
Fill the information for each committee member and create PGP key-pair on Hats dedicated tool or any other trusted tool.
  • The PGP keys will permit decrypt submissions.
  • Share this page with committee members to generate their own set of keys.
  • Please be aware you can decrypt submissions on the browser you created the keys on. You can open as many keys as you wish on multiple browser & devices.
translation.vaultEditorCommitteeDetailsSafeExplanati:
Add Gnosis-Safe committee multi-sig address. Don't have a Safe? open one on Gnosis. The committee members of your vault will automatically be added in the next page. Committee requirements:
  • Minimum amount of committee members is 3.
  • The minimum amount of signers is 2.
translation.vaultEditorSeveritiesExplanation:
Set the severities for the vault or use an existing vaults severities as a template.
  • The description of the severity level will serve as the primary criteria for determining whether the report aligns with this level of severity.
  • The max severity reward (%) will indicate the reward pay-out of each severity taking into account the available % allocated for bounties (the max bounty field below).
  • On the dApp will appear the max severity reward based on the available for bounties (the multiplication between max severity reward (%) and max bounty of the vault (%)). Basically it's the max % of the whole vault allocated fot that severity.
translation.vaultEditorContractsCoveredExplanation: Fill the information for each contract or asset covered. Add the address/URL of the asset and the possible severities.
translation.vaultEditorFinishedSetupExplanation: You have finished filling out all the info needed for setting up the vault.
translation.vaultEditorFinishedEditionExplanation: You have finished editing the vault. Now you can send this form to governance for approval.
translation.vaultEditorCreateVaultOnChainExplanation: Fill the info in order to create a vault. Once done you will be requested to execute a transaction that will create a vault on-chain.
translation.vaultEditorMaxBountyExplanation: The 'Max bounty' will set the max percent of the payable vault bounty. The max vault bounty allowed is 90%. (100% of the vault can't be payed within one bounty) Example: If a vault has 100K deposited and the max bounty is set to 90% in the case of a critical severity the max pay-out will be 90K. Set the max bounty (max 90%)
translation.vaultEditorBountySplitExplanation: The bounty split will set the way a bounty will split when a pay-out occurs. Set committee-controlled split (the total should be 100%)
translation.vaultEditorVaultPreviewExplanation: Preview your vault as it will appear on Hats dApp.
translation.vaultEditorFinalStepExplanation:
Create the vault by completing the on-chain transaction. 
 Once the transaction is executed, the vault is created on-chain 

 The vault description may be edited at any time, changes will be require Hat gov approval.
translation.committeeMembersOutsideMultisigExplanati: You can add committee members who are not part of Gnosis Safe. Please note, those committee members will be permitted to sign on pay-outs. They can only decrypt vulnerabilities sent to the vault.
translation.emailsNotVerifiedExplanation: In order to create the vault you have to verify the email address. The following email/s wasn't verified.
translation.vaultBlockedBecauseIsCreated: This vault can't be edited because it's already created on-chain. This is read-only mode. If you want to edit it, please go to the status page and do it there.
translation.vaultBlockedBecauseIsPendingCreation: This vault can't be edited because it's pending creation on-chain. Please wait while we are creating the vault on-chain.
translation.doneEditingTheExistingVault: Done editing the vault? Click on 'Send to governance approval' and Hats team will be notified to review the changed and update your vault.
translation.youAreEditingAnExistingVault: You are editing an existing vault. When you are done editing the vault, you can send it to governance approval.
translation.setMaxBountyHelper: Set the max % of the vault allocated for bounties
translation.editExistingVaultExplanation: Connect with a committee member wallet to edit an existing vault or view it's status
translation.youNeedToConnectToAWallet: You need to be connected to your wallet
translation.followingStepsVaultStatus: In order for your vault to appear on Hats live dApp please finish the following steps.
translation.editVaultHelp: You can request a edition on your vault's description. After that, the governance team will approve your request and update your vault.
translation.checkInExpanation: Press check-in and sign a transaction with the committee multi-sig address on Gnosis safe
translation.depositOnVaultExplanation:
Deposit assets to the vaults. 

 Vault deposit is needed for the vault listing on Hats live dApp.
translation.pendingApprovalExplanation: Pending approval - Hats team is reviewing your submission.
translation.vautlLiveExplanation: Your vault is live on Hats dApp.
translation.connectWithMultisigOrCheckInOnGnosis: Connect with the committee multisig using WalletConnect or check-in directly via Gnosis safe.
translation.connectWithCommitteeMultisig: You must be connected with the committee multisig using WalletConnect.
translation.connectWithCommitteeMultisigOrBeAMember: You must be connected with the committee multisig using WalletConnect or to be a vault committee member.
translation.approveTheTransactionOnSafeApp: Approve the transaction on the Gnosis safe app.
translation.vaultWithoutDescriptionError: Your vault doesn't have a description. Wait couple of minutes. If the problem continue, please contact Hats support.
translation.youCantExecuteThisTxWithMultisig: You can't execute this transaction with the committee multisig. Please use your personal wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeBountySplit:
Are you sure you want to change the bounty split percentages? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeMaxBounty:
Are you sure you want to change the max bounty percentage? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.areYouSureYouWantToChangeBothVaultParame:
Are you sure you want to change the bounty split and max bounty percentage? 

 * You will need to sign a transaction with your connected wallet.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsPendingApproval: You can't edit this vault because it's pending for governance approval. In order to edit this vault you need to cancel the current request clicking in the button below.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsStatus: You can't edit this vault because it's {{status}}. If you want to edit this vault, please go to the status page and request a new edition.
translation.youCantEditBecauseIsStatusShort: You can't edit this vault because it's {{status}}.
translation.existingEditSessionsHelperNoPendingAppro: These are the editions request you did to your vault. If you want to edit this vault, please click on the 'Edit vault' button below.
translation.existingEditSessionsHelperPendingApprova: These are the editions request you did to your vault. You have currently one edition waiting for approval, please wait until governance approve it or if you want you can cancel the approval request.
translation.editSessionIsNotDirty: You haven't made any changes to the vault description.
translation.weWillNotifyYouWhenEditionIsApproved: We will notify you when the edition is approved
translation.areYouSureYouWantToEditThisVault: Are you sure you want to request governance to edit vault's information?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToRemoveThisMember: Are you sure you want to remove this member?
translation.areYouSureYouWantToCancelApprovalRequest: Are you sure you want to cancel the approval request?
translation.thisVaultIsAlredyCreated: This vault is already created on-chain.
translation.weAreFinishingTheCreationOfVault:
Thanks for creating a new vault in Hats! 

 We are finishing the creation of your vault. We need a couple more minutes. 

 We will notify you via email you when the vault is created.
translation.executeTxOnGnosisForCreatingVault:
Thanks for creating a new vault in Hats! 

 You just create the proposal for creating the vault in gnosis safe. Please approve and execute the transaction on the gnosis app. 

 We will notify you via email you when the vault is created.
translation.weRecommendToAddAtLeastTwoMembers: We recommend to add at least two members to your vault.
translation.immediateSplitExplanation: Funds sent immediately to beneficiary's wallet
translation.vestedSplitExplanation: Funds vested 30 days, then sent to beneficiary's wallet.
translation.ifYouWantToConnectWalletConnect:
If you want to connect your multisig wallet with WalletConnect, follow these steps: 
 1. Open Gnosis safe WalletConnect app (pressing the button below). 
 2. Select 'WalletConnet' on the 'Connect Wallet' button. 
 3. Copy the QR code and paste it on Gnosis app.

vaultCreatedModal.titleMultisig: Please sign the vault creation request on Gnosis safe
vaultCreatedModal.titleNoMultisig: We are creating your vault on chain. This might take a few minutes
vaultCreatedModal.descriptionMultisig: After completing the process, you will receive an email with a link to the vault status and next steps.
vaultCreatedModal.descriptionNoMultisig: After completing the process, you will receive an email with a link to the vault status and next steps.

whereverModal.title: Wallet-to-Wallet notifications

Welcome.title: Hats
Welcome.description: We are changing the way security works to fit the culture, nature, and de-facto development processes of Ethereum by incentivizing black hat to become white hat hackers.

MyNFTs.two-transactions: In order to redeem the NFTs from both the Airdrop Machine and your deposit.You will be asked to sign two transactions on your wallet

EmbassyEligibility.title: NEW! Embassy eligibility
EmbassyEligibility.tier-minimum: The minimum requirement to enter an Embassy is {{minimum}} {{token}}
EmbassyEligibility.tier-middle: The minimum requirement for the {{secondOrThird}} level of trust of the Protector NFT is {{minimum}} {{token}}
EmbassyEligibility.after-deposit: After deposit confirmation, you will be eligible to redeem a Chain Protector NFT. In turn, this NFT will grant access to the Vault's Embassy.

TermsAndProcess.pre-submission: Before submitting vulnerability please read the steps and process that your request will go through.
TermsAndProcess.submission:
Your submission will be sent via a bot that is being run by the committee (i) who will process your submission.

The committee of the vault will respond within 12 hours to acknowledge the receipt of submission via the telegram user you provided.
TermsAndProcess.fix: Committee members will check your submission and then reach out to you through the telegram contact you shared with us. They will likely ask for one or both of the following:
TermsAndProcess.fix-question: Questions to help clarify your submission
TermsAndProcess.fix-error: Errors that they have identified in your submission
TermsAndProcess.fix-text-1: Confirmation of the accuracy of your submission and details regarding the solution including:
TermsAndProcess.awards-text-1:
For low-level severity vulnerabilities rewards are likely to be released within 14 days of the validation of your submission.

For medium, high and critical level severity vulnerabilities, rewards will be released within two weeks after the vulnerability has been properly addressed.
TermsAndProcess.awards-text-2: The size of your reward will be based on the decided severity. The severity is decided through the committee within the communicated periods
TermsAndProcess.warning-notice:
PLEASE BE AWARE!

If the vulnerability is exploited prior to the solution being implemented the reward will be voided. As such, please keep all activity in relation to Hats Finance vaults private and confidential.

Submit.review-notice: Please review your request before submitting:
Submit.submit-thanks: Hello new hatter, thank you for your submission!
Submit.submit-complete-text: While waiting, become an active member of our community and let us know what you think.
Submit.response-notice: If you have not received response within 12 hours please contact security@hats.finance in order to check if there is an issue with the bot or the committee.

RedeemNftSuccess.title: REDEEM SUCCESSFUL!
RedeemNftSuccess.text-3: The place where your security contribution can be valuable!
RedeemNftSuccess.text-4: WHY SHOULD I JOIN AN EMBASSY?
RedeemNftSuccess.text-5: Only individuals part of an embassy will be able to make governance proposals on protocol changes and the usage of the community treasury for Hats Finance.
RedeemNftSuccess.text-6: Be the first to learn about security topics related to your protocol.
RedeemNftSuccess.text-7: Be part of a unique group with the project committee.

AirdropPrompt.title: CONGRATS!
AirdropPrompt.text-1: You are eligible to Hats token airdrop machine
AirdropPrompt.text-3: Press continue to view your token eligibility and NFTs

section-1.title: HATS AIRDROP MACHINE
section-1.text:
Welcome to Hats Finance first airdrop machine. 

 The airdrop will go live in the coming months. Now is your chance to check your eligibility and join an Embassy
section-1.tooltip: Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project.

section-2.title: ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA
section-2.text-1: of the projects who are listed on Hats.
section-2.text-2: who added liquidity to one of the vaults (bug bounty) in Hats dApp.
section-2.text-3: will also be airdropped for their part in creating the community and expanding our reach. We are becoming a big clan!
section-2.text-4: security experts who participate in the Hats game.
section-2.text-5: a collective of experts who tested and helped the dev team from day one. We will forever remember your contribution during the early days of developing our vision and core ideas.

FAQ.answer-1: Every project that hosts a decentral bug bounty will form an embassy. Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project. The access will be managed by a special NFT that can be earned for contributions. Individuals that are either part of the committee that reviews disclosed exploits or who have deposited into the bug bounty will gain access to their Embassy.
FAQ.answer-2: A security council is a collective of different protocol users such as builders, community members and an array of security experts that contribute to the growth of a project. In our vision, we see a collective of security councils where users who participate in securing protocols are well rewarded for their contributions.
FAQ.question-3: WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY TOKENS?
FAQ.answer-3: The token will be available only when the Token Generated Event occurs. Please remember that you can receive the token only if you are eligible and hold the NFT.
FAQ.question-4: FOR HOW LONG CAN I REDEEM MY NFT?
FAQ.answer-4: Being part of the embassy will give you different perks in the future, but it's not mandatory to receive the future token airdrop. Please remember that you can receive the token only if you are eligible and hold the NFT.
FAQ.question-5: IF I WON’T JOIN AN EMBASSY CAN I STILL RECEIVE MY FUTURE TOKEN AIRDROP?
FAQ.answer-5: Yes, you can deposit to more than one vault and be part of their embassies.

CheckEligibility.text-1:
Connect your wallet to learn if you are eligible for Hats first airdrop. 

 The airdrop will become live in the next few months.
CheckEligibility.input-placeholder: Connect to wallet or paste a wallet adress
CheckEligibility.no-account: Please connect with a wallet to check eligibility

Redeemed.text-1: It seems you already redeemed your NFT, view your eligibility:

TokenEligibility.text-1: Your tokens will be availble when the airdrop becomes live in the next few months.
TokenEligibility.text-3: In order to stay eligible and receive your token airdrop you must redeem your NFT

NFTAirdrop.text-1:
To claim the token airdrop, when the airdrop become live, you will need to hold the below NFT in your wallet. 

 The NFT will generate you an access to the project Embassy - redeem and join!
NFTAirdrop.text-3: Every project that hosts a decentral bug bounty will form an embassy. Embassies are token gated communities for those that have proof of participating in the security of a project. The access will be managed by a special NFT that can be earned for contributions. Individuals that are either part of the committee that reviews disclosed exploits or who have deposited into the bug bounty will gain access to their Embassy.

EmbassyNftTicketPrompt.title: EMBASSY NFT
EmbassyNftTicketPrompt.text: Redeem your NFT and join the vault's Embassy on Discord to continue to make a difference to protocol security.

Welcome.title: Welcome to the committee tools
Welcome.content-1: The committe tools allow you to easily decrypt vulnerabilities messages submitted by hackers.
Welcome.content-2: In order to decrypt a message you will need to:
Welcome.step-1-content: Create a Keystore using a password. Your password will be used to encrypt the storage.
Welcome.step-3-content: The encryption works with a private and public keys, where the public key is visible to all people and is used to encrypt messages,the private key should be available only to committee members and allows them to decrypt and read the messages.
Welcome.content: We provide you with these tools to allow you to easily decrypt messages received by attackers. You have to createa your vault using a password which will be used to encrypt the storage.
Welcome.create-description: Please create a password for your keystore
Welcome.create-addenum: Make sure to save your password in a secure place. Your password can reveal all your private keys, if you lose it, the vault becomes unreadable and may only be deleted.
Welcome.delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete your vault? type 'yes' to confirm

KeyDetails.title: Key Details
KeyDetails.description: Your private key should be shared with your committee members only via secure chat.

keymodal.intro-text: Please generate a key pair or import a key if you are already holding one
keymodal.title: Generate/import key-Pairs
keymodal.create-text: Create new key and a passphrase
keymodal.import-text: Import a key using your private key & passphrase
keymodal.delete-text: Are you sure you want to delete key-pair?
keymodal.name: Name
keymodal.generate-message: Please generate private and public PGP keys by creating an alias and a passphrase(optional).
keymodal.share-public: Please share your public key with the committee members
keymodal.generated-notice-1:
Please notice! 

 Your private key should be shared with your committee members only via secure chat. 

 The public key is used by Hats to encrypt messages from white hat attackers. 

 Please take a minute and send the the public key to
keymodal.generated-notice-2: to be added to Hats json file

Decrypt.decrypt-description: Hello @committee member, Generate or import key-pair in order to decrypt
Decrypt.encrypted-message-placeholder: Enter here the message you want to decrypt
Decrypt.decrypted-message-placeholder: Here you will see the decrypted message

VaultEditor.title: Vault Editor
VaultEditor.create-vault-description: Please refer to @hatsofir on telegram if you have any questions.
VaultEditor.signatureMessage: I hereby confirm the details in ipfs hash {{ipfsHash}}.
VaultEditor.pgp-key-description: Please Create A Keystore And PGP Key-Pair On Our Dedicated Tool. It will only be stored on the browser's local storage.
VaultEditor.pgp-key-alternative: Or just paste an existing PGP Public Key on the text box below
VaultEditor.pgp-key-hint-2: Are To Be Generated By The Vault Committee/Signers Only!
VaultEditor.pgp-key-hint-tooltip: The encryption works with a private and public PGP keys, where the public key is visible to all people and is used to encrypt messages. The private key should be available only to committee members and allows them to decrypt and read the messages.
VaultEditor.contract-address-placeholder: Contract/asset address or link to GitHub/Block explorer
VaultEditor.nft-description-placeholder: A short description of the NFT

review-vault.title: Review Vault
review-vault.description-1: In order to submit the form for review by hats team.
review-vault.description-2: Complete the transaction by authorized signer/s
review-vault.description-3: You may be asked to add details to the vault by @hatsOfir
